question: I am an undergraduate student in my first/second/third/fourth year [pick as appropriate]. Am I eligible to apply?
I am an undergraduate student in my final year; I will graduate in 2021. Am I eligible to apply?
I am an undergraduate student from [your location; any country, anywhere]. Am I eligible to apply?
answer: Please do! Except, please note that Brown is on EST US time and many of our synchronous events will be in those working hours.

question: I am an undergraduate student from [any university or college institution, anywhere]. Am I eligible to apply?
Is this program only for Brown University undergraduate students?
answer: No; we like the rest of you too ; )

question: Is this program only for underrepresented groups or [x] students?
answer: The goal of the exploreCSR program is to support students from underrepresented groups to pursue graduate studies and research careers in computing (here). We will consider all applicants, but our focus is on this goal.

question: I am a masters or PhD student. Am I eligible to apply?
I am on a gap year but will be starting soon/returning soon. Am I eligible to apply?
Are the applications first come, first serve?
answer: No. We will consider all applications received by the deadline (January 1st, 2021) in one go.

question: The application form asks for a transcript. Should I wait to add my grades from this semester or should I submit without?
answer: Our application deadline is January 1st, 2021—please submit what you have available by then. Please don't plan to email us an updated transcript later on.

question: I didn't receive a confirmation of my application. Can you confirm receipt?
answer: It almost certainly went through. If you're worried, submit another one! We'll pick up the latest submitted on January 1st. No need to email us for this one.

question: I submitted my form, but received the error: '(You can't respond to exploreCSR 2020-2021: Socially Responsible AI for Computational Creativity. Uploading files is not permitted when data loss prevention is enabled for your domain. Contact your domain administrator if you think this is a mistake.).' What should I do?
answer: It looks like your institution does not support file uploads via Google Forms. You should be able to get around this by filling out the form while logged into to a personal (i.e. non-college-affiliated) Google account (you'd have one of these if you have a personal Gmail address, for instance).
